storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications for schedule changes to stay informed

testCases.title: Validate notification generation and display for schedule changes
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one scheduled shift in the system
Manager/Admin has permissions to modify employee schedules
Notification system is operational and configured
Employee is not currently logged into the system

steps.action: Log in as Manager/Admin with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager/Admin successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface loads with current employee schedules visible

steps.action: Select the target employee's existing shift and modify the schedule (change time, date, or location)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule modification form is displayed with current shift details

steps.action: Save the schedule change
steps.expectedResult: System confirms schedule change is saved successfully and notification is generated in the system

steps.action: Log out as Manager/Admin
steps.expectedResult: Manager/Admin is successfully logged out

steps.action: Log in as the affected employee using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications section in the web interface
steps.expectedResult: Notifications page loads displaying all notifications for the employee

steps.action: Verify the new schedule change notification is displayed with details of the change
steps.expectedResult: New notification is visible showing schedule change details (date, time, shift information) with unread status indicator

steps.action: Click on the notification to mark it as read
steps.expectedResult: Notification is marked as read and visual indicator changes (e.g., bold text becomes normal, unread badge disappears)

steps.action: Refresh the notifications page
steps.expectedResult: Notification status remains as read and the updated status persists in the UI

steps.action: Log out as employee
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully logged out

postconditions: Notification is generated and stored in the database
Notification status is marked as read in the system
Schedule change is reflected in employee's schedule
Employee is logged out of the system

testCases.title: Verify notification access control
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A has valid login credentials
Employee B has at least one notification in the system
Authentication and authorization mechanisms are properly configured
API endpoint GET /api/notifications is secured with authentication

steps.action: Log in as Employee A with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee A successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications section
steps.expectedResult: Notifications page loads displaying only Employee A's notifications

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's notifications by manipulating the URL or API request (e.g., changing employee ID parameter)
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays an error message indicating 'Access Denied' or 'Unauthorized' (HTTP 403 or 401)

steps.action: Verify that no notification data from Employee B is visible or accessible
steps.expectedResult: No notifications belonging to Employee B are displayed or returned in the response

steps.action: Check browser console or network tab for error response
steps.expectedResult: Error response confirms authorization failure with appropriate error code and message

steps.action: Log out as Employee A
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully logged out

postconditions: Employee A remains unable to access Employee B's notifications
Security audit log records the unauthorized access attempt
Employee A is logged out of the system
No data breach or unauthorized data access occurred

testCases.title: Test notification delivery timing
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has at least one scheduled shift
Manager/Admin has permissions to modify schedules
System clock is synchronized and accurate
Employee is logged into the system with notifications page open

steps.action: Log in as Employee and navigate to the notifications section
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and notifications page is displayed

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and number of existing notifications
steps.expectedResult: Current time is recorded and baseline notification count is established

steps.action: In a separate browser session, log in as Manager/Admin and navigate to schedule management
steps.expectedResult: Manager/Admin successfully accesses schedule management interface

steps.action: Record the exact timestamp and make a schedule change for the logged-in employee
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change is saved with timestamp recorded (T0)

steps.action: Return to the employee's browser session and refresh the notifications page every 10 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Notifications page refreshes and displays updated notification list

steps.action: Record the timestamp when the new notification appears in the employee's interface
steps.expectedResult: New notification is visible with timestamp recorded (T1)

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between schedule change (T0) and notification delivery (T1)
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is calculated: (T1 - T0)

steps.action: Verify that the notification delivery time is within 1 minute (60 seconds) of the schedule change
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery time (T1 - T0) is less than or equal to 60 seconds, meeting the performance requirement

steps.action: Log out from both employee and manager sessions
steps.expectedResult: Both users are successfully logged out

postconditions: Notification was delivered within the 1-minute SLA
Schedule change is reflected in the system
Performance metric is recorded for monitoring
Both users are logged out of the system
